alert.note: Alert for Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 1:53AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, eastern Lycoming and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muncy, Hughesville, Muncy Valley, Biggertown, Kettle Creek Gorge, Lairdsville, Lincoln Falls, Ricketts Glen State Park, Picture Rocks, Dushore, Laporte, Forksville, Eagles Mere and Hillsgrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
